beer.beer_description: There’s nothing ominous about this dark, daring and delicious beer. It has a lovely hoppy, bitter-sweet flavour that finishes with a note of hazelnuts. Try it with roast beef or venison.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 160 check-ins with a photo.

At first taste, dark ales can be overwhelming for even the most skilled of beer drinkers, but your will is weak and with time you will eventually turn to the dark side. That's 10 different beers with the style of Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Lager - Dark, IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale or IPA - Imperial / Double Black, Schwarzbier, or Mild - Dark. Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description: There’s nothing ominous about this dark, daring and delicious beer. It has a lovely hoppy, bitter-sweet flavour that finishes with a note of hazelnuts. Try it with roast beef or venison.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 150 check-ins with a photo.

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 5 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description: There’s nothing ominous about this dark, daring and delicious beer. It has a lovely hoppy, bitter-sweet flavour that finishes with a note of hazelnuts. Try it with roast beef or venison.

items.badge_description: Planning on calling out tomorrow? If not, we’ll be sure to have some coffee ready for you! Drink 5 beers during the week after 10PM (to midnight).

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 10 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.badge_description: Dispensed traditionally by hand pump, cask beers are best served at 55°F. This temperature allows all of the flavor nuances to emerge and permits appreciation of the often unfiltered texture. That's 420 checkins with the serving style of Cask! Try 5 more for Level 85!

user.bio: Beer is anywhere between 95-98% water, which means it’s 95-98% good for you.
I just go out for a “Quiet Drink”. Sometimes it doesn’t end up that way.?
